decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - The development hereby permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of the original permission reference 00094/AP/P1 dated 13th January 2017.

Condition : 2 - The proposed development shall be carried out in all respects in accordance with the proposals contained in the application and the plans submitted (270-PE-XX-XX-DR-A-9000 Rev P01, 270-PE-XX-DR-DR-C-0501 Rev P01, 270-PE-XX-XX-DR-A-9002 Rev P03, BB93 Assessment, Drainage statement, Framework Construction Logistics Plan, Phase I Environmental Survey, Flood Risk Assessment, Thermal Modeling Report, Sustainable Design Statement, Preliminary Air Quality Assessment, Ecological Impact Assessment, Tree Survey, Arboricultural Impact Assessment, Preliminary Arboricultural Method Statement and Tree Protection Plan, Travel Plan, Combined Geotechnical and Quantitative Ground Contamination Risk Assessment. Received: 15th November 2016. 270-PE-XX-ZZ-DR-A-9012 Rev P02, 270-PE-XX-ZZ-DR-A-9010 Rev P02, 270-PE-XX-XX-DR-A-9002 Rev P04, 270-PE-XX-02-DR-A-9007 Rev P02, 270-PE-XX-01-DR-A-9006 Rev P01, 270-PE-XX-00-DR-A-9005 Rev P02, 207-PE-XX-00-DR-A-9004 Rev P02, 270-PE-XX-00-DR-A-9003 Rev P03, 270-PE-XX-00-DR-A-9001 Rev P02, 270-PE-XX-XX-DR-A-9009 Rev P02, 270-PE-XX-XX-DR-A-9008 Rev P02, BREEAM 2014 Progress Sheet. Received: 7th December 2016. Sustainable Design Statement. Received: 16th December 2016. Design and Access Statement. Received: 21st December 2016. Transport Statement. Received: 22nd December 2016. 270-PE-XX-DR-DR-C-0501 Rev P02. Received: 23rd December 2016 

Application form. Received: 2nd June 2017) therewith and approved by the Local Planning Authority, or as shall have been otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority before the building is used.

Condition : 3 - The materials to be used in the construction of the hereby approved development shall be in strict accordance with the details submitted and approved under application reference 00094/AP/P1(3) dated 24th May 2017.

Condition : 4 - During the course of the development: 

C. The Local Planning Authority shall be notified immediately if additional contamination is discovered during the course of the development. A competent person shall assess the additional contamination, and shall submit appropriate amendments to the scheme for decontamination in writing to the Local Planning Authority for approval before any work on that aspect of development continues. 

Before the development is first brought into use: 
D. The agreed scheme for decontamination as approved under reference 00094/AP/P1(4) dated 2nd May 2017 and c) above, including amendments, shall be fully implemented and a written validation (closure) report submitted to the Local Planning Authority for approval.

Condition : 5 - The measured outlined in the approved school travel plan under planning reference 00094/AP/P1(5) dated 24th May 2017 shall be implemented prior to the use hereby permitted commencing and shall be so maintained for the duration of the use, unless the prior written approval of the Local Planning Authority is obtained to any variation.

Condition : 6 - The hereby approved car park as shown on the submitted plans shall be managed in strict accordance with the car park management plan approved under planning reference 00094/AP/P1(6-10) dated 24th May 2017 for the duration of the development.

Condition : 7 - The hereby approved development shall be carried out in strict accordance with the Construction Management and Logistics Plan and Statement approved under planning reference 00094/AP/P1(6-10) dated 24th May 2017 and shall be adhered to throughout the course of the development.

Condition : 8 - The development shall be implemented in strict accordance with the approved Energy Strategy under planning reference 00094/AP/P1(8) dated 2nd May 2017 and shall not commence above ground until full Design Stage calculations under the National Calculation Method have been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local planning Authority to show that the development will be constructed in accordance with the approved Energy Strategy, and any subsequent approved revisions. 

Prior to first occupation of the building(s) evidence (e.g. photographs, installation contracts and As-Built certificates under the National Calculation Method should be submitted to the Local Planning Authority and approved in writing to show that the development has been constructed in accordance with the approved Energy Strategy, and any subsequent approved revisions.

Condition : 9 - Within three months of work starting on site a BREEAM Design Stage certificate and summary score sheet (or such equivalent standard that replaces this) must be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority to show that an 'Excellent' (minimum score 70%) rating will be achieved. 

Within 11 weeks of first occupation of the building(s) a BREEAM Post-Construction Review certificate and summary score sheet (or such equivalent standard that replaces this) must be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority to show that an 'Excellent' (minimum score 70%) rating has been achieved.

Condition : 10 - Cycle parking shall be provided on site in strict accordance with the details submitted and approved under application reference 00094/AP/P1(6-10) dated 24th May 2017 prior to first occupation of the site and shall be permanently retained as such thereafter.

Condition : 11 - In this condition "retained tree" means an existing tree which is to be retained in accordance with the approved plans and particulars; and paragraphs (a) and (b) below shall have effect until the expiration of (5 years) from (the date of the occupation of the building for its permitted use). 
(a)No retained tree shall be cut down, uprooted or destroyed, nor shall any retained tree be topped or lopped other than in accordance with the approved plans and particulars, without the written approval of the local planning authority. Any topping or lopping approved shall be carried out in accordance with British Standard [3998 (Tree Work)] or any other BS replacing. 
(b)If any retained tree is removed, uprooted or destroyed or dies, another tree shall be planted at the same place and that tree shall be of such size and species, and shall be planted at such time, as may be specified in writing by the local planning authority. 

(c)The erection of fencing for the protection of any retained tree shall be undertaken in accordance with the approved plans and particulars before any equipment, machinery or materials are brought on to the site for the purposes of the development, and shall be maintained until all equipment, machinery and surplus materials have been removed from the site. Nothing shall be stored or placed in any area fenced in accordance with this condition and the ground levels within those areas shall not be altered, nor shall any excavation be made, without the written consent of the local planning authority.

Condition : 12 - The Acoustic insulation of the building shall be carried out in strict accordance with the submitted BB93 Assessment dated 27th July 2016 received on the 15th November 2016 within application reference 00094/AP/P1 dated 13th January 2017.
Condition : 13 - The final drainage scheme shall be implemented in strict accordance with the details approved under planning reference 00094/AP/P1(13) dated 3rd July 2017.
Condition : 14 - No additional floorspace shall be formed within the buildings hereby permitted without prior written consent of the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 15 - No demolition or construction work shall take place on the site except between the hours of 8:00am  to 6:00pm on Mondays to Friday and 9 :00am to 1:00pm on Saturdays and none shall take place on Sundays and Public Holidays without the prior agreement of the Local Planning Authority.
description: Variation of condition 9 (BREEAM Certificates) to be produced within 11 weeks instead of prior to first occupation following planning permission 00094/AP/P1 dated 13/01/2017 for proposed new build single storey Pupil Referral unit (PRU) pimary SEN school for 30 pupils year age 4-11. The proposal comprise of Early Years, Key Stage 1 and Key Stage 2 classrooms, learning and support facilities for pupils and staffs, multi purpose hall, storages, plant room and server room. Proposed 2.4 m high anti-climb fencing all around site with sliding metal gate for vehicular access and secured metal gates for pedestrian access/exit, basketball hoops and 5.2 m metal fencing all around the court, detached roof canopy of 50sqm covered area at rear and proposed car park area on front.
